About MeHello, I’m Qi Cao (曹婍), an assistant professor at the Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences. I recerved my Ph.D. degree in Computer Science from the University of Chinese Academy of Sciences under the supervision of Prof. Guojie Li and Prof. Huawei Shen in 2020. Before that, I received my B.S. degree from Renmin University of China in 2015. Research Interest Trustworthy Graph Machine Learning Adversarial attacks and defense for graph neural networks Robustness and fairness for recommender systems Social Media Computing and Mining Information diffusion prediction Network representation learning News 05/2022 Our paper Conditional GANs with Auxiliary Discriminative Classifier is accepted in ICML 2022. 04/2022 Our paper INMO: A Model-Agnostic and Scalable Module for Inductive Collaborative Filteringis accepted in SIGIR 2022. 03/2022 Our paper PREP: Pre-training with Temporal Elapse Inference for PopularityPrediction is accepted in WWW 2022. 09/2021 Our paper Self-Supervised GANs with Label Augmentation is accepted in NeurIPS 2021 08/2021 Our Paper Single Node Injection Attack against Graph Neural Networks is accepted in CIKM 2021 10/2020 Our Paper Adversarial Immunization for Improving Certifiable Robustness on Graphs is accepted in WSDM 2021 More publications please refer here ProjectsHornors and Awards 2021, Chinese Information Processing Society of China (CIPS) Outstanding Doctoral Dissertation Award Nomination 2020, IEEE International Conference on Big Data and Smart Computing (IEEE BigComp) Best Paper Award (2nd Place) 2020, President Award of Chinese Academy of Sciences 2019, Special Award for the Director of the Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences 2018, National Conference of Social Media Processing (SMP) Best Report Award 2017, CIKM Student Travel Award Academic Services Program Committee Members for Conference：AAAI 2021, WWW 2021, WSDM 2021, WWW 2022 Reviewers for Journals: TCSS, JASIST, TIST
